tr.td: Under the Find... heading, locate and click Find a Course.
Under the Create... heading, select Create a Course. You can then choose to start a blank course proposal or copy an existing course to a new proposal.
Under the Find... heading, locate and click Find a Course to locate the course you want to modify. Once viewing the course, use the Course Actions menu to select Modify Course.
Under the Find... heading, locate and click Find a Course to locate the course you want to retire. Once viewing the course, use the Course Actions menu to select Retire Course.

td.b: View a course's history or compare two versions of a course?

tr.td: Under the Find heading, locate and click Find a Course to locate the course you want to view. Once viewing the course, you can click the Version History link near the course title. If the course has multiple versions, click the box for both versions and then click Show Version(s) for a side by side comparison.

td.b: Check the status of my proposal?

tr.td: Click My Action List near the top of the page. At the Action List, click on Outbox to find proposals you've submitted and their associated status.
Under the Find... heading, locate and click Find a Course Proposal link. Leave the search criteria blank and click the Search button if you want to see a list of all proposals.

Click My Action List near the top of the page. At the Action List, view a proposal by clicking the Id number. Once viewing the proposal, use the Proposal Actions menu to approve or reject the proposal.
How do I take these specific course actions...

td.b: Change a Course Prefix and/or Course Number for an Existing Course?

tr.td: Modify the course by first clicking Find a Course to locate the course you want to modify. Once viewing the course, use the Course Actions menu to select Modify Course. Modify course prefix and/or number. Submit proposal.

td.b: Create a Pilot (course for a one-term offering pending approval)?

tr.td: Under the Create... heading, select Create a Course. Fill in course information. On Active Dates screen, select term you want to offer the course from Start Term menu. Check the Pilot Course box indicating that the course will be a pilot. Submit proposal. Contact the Registrar's Office at schedule@umd.edu to have pilot course approved administratively.

td.b: Request an additional term for a Pilot course?

tr.td: Modify the course by first clicking Find a Course to locate the course you want to modify. Once viewing the course, use the Course Actions menu to select Modify Course. On Active Dates screen, select next term that you want to offer the Pilot course from Start Term menu. Check the Pilot Course box indicating that the course will continue to be a pilot. Submit the proposal. Contact Mike Colson at mcolson@umd.edu in the Office of Academic Planning and Programs for administrative approval.

td.b: Request that a Pilot course become a permanently approved course?

tr.td: Modify the course by first clicking Find a Course to locate the course you want to modify. Once viewing the course, use the Course Actions menu to select Modify Course. After entering required course information, select the term that you want to start offering the course from Start Term menu on the Active Dates screen. Make sure that the Pilot Course box is unchecked. Make sure that the Start Term is after the last Pilot term. Submit Proposal.
